author: tersec
content: is it intentional that https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/fulu/das-core.md#get_custody_groups in the name of "Overflow prevention" skips the zero `NodeID`? That's not just overflow protection, that's conceptually, the `NodeID` sequence it iterates through is 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639934, 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935, _not_ 0, 1, 2, ...

author: jtraglia
content: Hmm yeah that is a little strange. I don't think it should skip 0.

author: agnxsh
content: i suspect it was working well inspite of this because usually when we resolve node id from a peer id, we derive the uint256 number by extracting a secp256k1 key assigned against the peerid, and the likelihood of getting either 0'u256 or u256.high is extremely low

author: agnxsh
content: can we have a test vector for this corner case in consensus specs (setting the nodeid to UINT256_MAX) <@592004585506340885> ?

author: agnxsh
content: best if it releases with alpha 11 ofc

author: jtraglia
content: We already have test cases for this. See: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/e6bddd966214a19d2b97199bbe3c02577a22a8b4/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/fulu/networking/test_get_custody_groups.py#L55-L63 To be clear, skipping 0 isn't really a bug, it's just not what one would expect.
